title: UNISpec
description: Description of UNISpec for Ordering- source 57.1

physicalLayer.description: This attribute is a list of physical layers, one for each physical link implementing the UNI

synchronousMode.description: The Synchronous Mode Service Attribute is a list with one item for each of the physical links implementing the UNI. When the value of an item is "Enabled," the bits transmitted from the CEN to the CE on the physical link corresponding to the item can be used by the CE as a bit clock reference

numberOfLinks.description: A UNI can be implemented with one or more physical links. This attribute specifies the number of such links.

tokenShareEnabled.description: Identifies whether a given UNI is capable of sharing tokens across Bandwidth Profile Flows in an Envelope.  The default is disabled ("false").

uniResiliency.description: The UNI Resiliency Service Attribute value can be "None," "2-Link Aggregation," or "Other."

maxServiceFrameSize.description: Indicates the maximum service frame size that can be reliably processed at the UNI level

allToOneBundling.description: All-to-One Bundling can be either Enabled or Disabled. A value of True would equate to Enabled

linkOamEnabled.description: Link OAM enables the operator to monitor and troubleshoot a single Ethernet link.

uniMegEnabled.description: Request for monitoring of a UNI.

uniEthernetLmiEnabled.description: Indicates the desire for management of the customer interface. For ordering, this is an optional parameter that may be requested

uniL2cpAddressSet.description: Identifies the discard/pass action for all non-peered layer two control protocols.

uniL2cpPeering.description: Can be either an empty list, or a list of entries identifying protocols to be peered where each entry consists of {Destination Address, Protocol Identifier} or {Destination Address, Protocol Identifier, Link Identifier}.
